Reviews.Content: I had originally bought another brand but the pictures turned out pixelated when printed so I couldn't live with that so I was told by the sales person at the store I went to to try Canon. It was just a few dollars more so I bought it. So far I'm happy with it. I have read the about the problems with battery but I don't take many pictures so that shouldn't be an issue for me. The things I was looking for was picture quality and ease of use. Those two things seem fine. I am satisfied with the pictures and the settings are fairly easy to set and understand for a none photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Sandip Shah "SonyFan"
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this product for gift. I checked it performance by taking couple pictures, downleaded to computer, the results is amazing. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Don't Get It.... Mine was only camera that didn't work at Christmas
Reviews.Author: His Royalty
Reviews.Content: This camera IS too sensitive to low light, but not just low light.  At Christmas, several cameras were taking pictures and working fine, but this one was the only one that would not, not only on certain settings but on all of them.  I trust it would work outdoors, but I didn't spend this money to have a camera for 'outdoor use only.'  I'm not super picky about a camera, but if I have one, I do ask that it take photos! Look for a different camera!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: GabVal
Reviews.Content: After purchasing three different types of cameras for family use, I decided to keep this one since it gave me the BEST PICTURE QUALITY!!  The others where on the same price range (Sony cybershot, and Nikon), and none of those brands worked very well for what I was looking for.  I take a lot of pictures to my kids and family, we use it for traveling and so far it's been wonderful, I LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Redwine
Reviews.Content: I have three of these models that didn't even last for 6 months, one lasted three weeks. There is an issue with the lens retracting system. I contacted Canon with no results. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Wrong parts sent
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: The camera I purchased was sent with a charger that was not a cannon charger. Let alone, a charger that wasn't even compatible with the camera's battery. When I contacted the sender, his response was ' did u plug it in from the wrong direction?' REALLY.... I'm still waiting to see my refund.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: light
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in about 2 days, instead of the 5-8 days. which was awesome since I bought this item as a gift. The family who got the camera loves it. They really like the rechargeable battery and the fact that the menu is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Missed photos
Reviews.Author: Jeff S Mueller
Reviews.Content: This camera does not click fast enough. The best picture was the one you tried to take 3 seconds ago. Clicking the camera did not take the photo instantly it delayed the shutter. I also had more blurred photos than I had with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Aldemar
Reviews.Content: MUY BUENA CAMARA, PEQUEÑA Y BIEN FUNCIONAL, LES RECOMIENDO YA QUE ES DEL TAMAÑO DE UNA TARJETA DE CREDITO Y TIENE MUY BUENA DEFINICION EN SUS IMAGENES

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Plazewski
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a few days ago and absolutly love it. I was considering the Canon Powershot A3300 16 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black) but decided to stick with the less expensive A2200 and it has exceeded my expectations. Just the past few days I have taken some great pictures. I'm so glad I purchased this.

Reviews.Title: Broke in a week
Reviews.Author: K. Downer
Reviews.Content: I used the new camera for about a week until the lense got stuck open, rendering the camera useless. I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: Grainiest photos I have ever seen
Reviews.Author: Aaronb483
Reviews.Content: I love Canon products, but this camera produces the grainiest photos. I know 14 megapixels is a lot for a small chip. But I never thought it would be this bad.Please leave a comment if you think I have a bad camera or I have it set wrong.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Dirk Grupe
Reviews.Content: To start with the positive aspects of this camera first, it has a nice red colorand the time is in 24 hours and you can also adjust the date format. It alsoallows you to define a lot of settings yourself, so you do not have to dealwith automatic settings. Also it has a relatively large display so you can viewthe image. I also think it is quite easy to operate in general. To set thebasic shooting modes with a little wheel is a very good idea.However, otherwise it is basically a quite expensive piece of junk!It is probably one of the slowest digital cameras on the planet.I don't know what happened to Canon, but theymust have thought to design a retro-camera with readout out times you had withthe first digital cameras about 15 years ago. Unbelievable! If you want to makeany kind of photo of a moving object it will be moved out of the picture by thetime you can shoot the photo. Even if you try to take a photo of a static objectthe quality of the photo is poor. It is grainy, noisy, and blurry. I have setthe camera to 80 ASA, the Fine resolution and 14.1 Mpix and still got grainynoisy photos. The optics is poor, too. All photos show a blurring which you'llget from scattered light in the optical system. My son has a$25 Vivitar camera which is not only significantly faster, but the images areonly slightly worse. Now you won't expect an excellent photos with a $25 camera, butyou can expect some decent shots from a $100 camera. We also have a 4 year old Canon SD 1100ISwhich is a good camera, so I did expect that in 4 years Canon would haveinvested some money into development. Well, they did, for some gimmicks, like atoy camera effect of softening for portraits. However with this camera this is apermanent feature. Instead of wasting money for gimmicks like this it would havebeen better spending the money on developing better optics, CCDs and readoutelectronics. The A2200 is basically useless, except if you like grainy, blurryimages of something that does not move. Then this is the camera for you.So as a conclusion, the A2200 looks nice but that it. Otherwise I would notrecommend this camera at all. It's a complete waste of money.My wife actually returned it back to Walmart and got a blender instead. The money iscertainly better spend that way.

Reviews.Title: The manual could be better.
Reviews.Author: Life long reader "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I worked in a photo lab for several years and took thousands of images.  I have enlarged several, which are now hanging on our walls.The digital age has arrived now, and I welcome it.First, I like the cameras' size.Getting started, the manual states that the date, when entered will hold for a long time.  As the manual stated, I removed the battery when not in use.  After reinserting the battery, the date shows up blank.  This has happened a number of times.  I am missing something.  I noticed that the manual was printed in China, which could present a problem.  I then installed the CD on the computer, and after a number of steps involving registration, the message came on screen that no brochure was available.  Has anyone else had similar concerns?

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot  A2200
Reviews.Author: lydia
Reviews.Content: I just bought this canon powershot A2200 yesterday. I love the functions, the easy to use buttons. I cannot wait till tomorrow to go and take pictures.I love the size of the camera and needed a small camera besides my Nikon D50 which is sometimes awkward.  I returned the Kodak camera and decided to try Canon!! I had a canon many years ago and remember how sharp the pictures were!!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my friend but had to do some testing before i could give it to him, so I took a few shots and tested all the features in it. I liked the Macro feature in this camera- it was really cool that a camera with less complexity could do it. Had an ideal flash for night time pictures. Overall I would recommend anyone to buy this. But would have been glad had a got an SD card with this.

Reviews.Title: stupid
Reviews.Author: soni abraham
Reviews.Content: cheating,this one never working,no battery inside,click button is not functioning,led screen completely scratched,i hate it ,they said it is look like brand new but nasty

Reviews.Title: Great camera takes nice pictures
Reviews.Author: austin83339
Reviews.Content: got this for my mom for Christmas easy to use and takes nice pictures. Camera is great but description was a little vague and had several scuffs on the screen but overall a great camera.

Reviews.Title: don't buy refurbished!
Reviews.Author: lilkonza
Reviews.Content: Received a broken item.  The on/off button is defective.  Not a good bargain since I still don't have a camera and will have to pay the local camera shop to fix the button.

Reviews.Title: Dayenu (for better or for worse)
Reviews.Author: Brian Connors
Reviews.Content: I went into this with an interesting problem. You see, the A2200 is a reasonably solid camera with surprisingly good picture quality for the fingernail-sized sensor, which is par for the course with Canon; the optics are about equivalent to the kit lens on an EOS Rebel DSLR, so although you won't be reading shelf tags from 50 feet away, you can still print out a pretty good sized blowup of any given shot. If you don't need 1080i video out of a pocket camera, this is pretty much all the pocket-sized camera you'll need. (Yes, it's pretty slow on the draw, but if you need speed, consider moving up to a system camera, or at least a bridge camera like the SX40.) The 14.1Mpx resolution is excessive bordering on ludicrous, and unless you need HDMI out (in which case you should move up to the Elph/Ixus series), you're not going to need much more than this. (Which is not to knock the A3300, but...)But one of the big selling points of Canon's 2011 A-series (at least from the 1200 up) is the addition of what Canon calls Creative Filters -- a series of special effects that mimic some of the capabilities of other cameras. That's the sticking point here, and, well, apart from fisheye (which works well enough to avoid spending gazillions on a fisheye lens for your DSLR) and the monochrome settings (bluescale is an interesting touch), most of it is fluff. The miniature setting, for example, is meant to duplicate the miniaturizing effects of shooting long distances with a macro lens, and really kind of doesn't work. The toy camera setting (probably the feature that will most jump out at a prospective buyer) is, to put it politely, fraudulent; it's like a Budweiser version of a Holga. It lacks the unpredictability that makes toy cameras popular, and the aggressive vignetting is a little too extreme unless you crop back to a 120-like square frame. (It also seems to pull some strange optical tricks when used with a flash and sharp corners, but I don't think I could reproduce that if I tried.) The Live View mode is much more useful if you want to tweak the colors to get that expired film look. The Discreet mode is a very nice feature indeed, perfect for taking into a store and taking picture notes of price tags or other sneaky behavior that you'd normally pull with a cell phone. Video quality is okay, not spectacular; the lack of image stabilization and live video zoom on this model makes it more of an afterthought than a useful feature, though it should work fine on a tripod.I was not able to test some of the more esoteric capabilities; the CHDK port for this model is painfully buggy (a supposedly-usable version shipped a couple days before this review but I haven't installed it yet), and from what I understand raw pictures come out with badly garbled color data, rendering them essentially useless for any purpose but debugging. One-handed operation is clumsy (one attempt while writing this review accidentally triggered the onscreen clock function) but workable with some practice. The software is the same software that Canon ships with all their cameras; I can't speak for the Windows side, but ImageBrowser for Mac has most of the same functionality as iPhoto, only a bit less polished.So, in conclusion, if you need an inexpensive pocket camera, the A2200 should be everything you need. You won't go wrong with it, although some of the features it includes are vastly overrated. (Expect to be laughed out of the room if you're entering your photos in a low-fi photo competition; it's incapable of sucking enough to do the job right.) For that reason, I have to give it only four stars. If all Canon had given us was a solid replacement for cameras like my old, beat-up A3000IS... well, you read the headline, but...

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: washercan4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this camera! It is small and compact, and takes wonderful pictures. We love the high quality of video it takes! Perfect camera for perfect price!!

Reviews.Title: Missing Battery
Reviews.Author: ASEEM DAYAL
Reviews.Content: Hi , I just wanted to let you know ,  I had presented this camera to a overseas friend of mine ; he informed me that the package was missing the battery. He ended up purchasing  a new battery from a  local store - It is an embarrassment for me :-(

Reviews.Title: You can't change the file resolution
Reviews.Author: miatamiata
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Price- photo quality- rechargeable battery and charger- compact- nice looking- easy to useCons:- cannot change the file resolution, so you end up filling up cards and disk more quickly than I would like. The quality is decent for the price, but I wish there was the option to save as a 4-6Mpixel file.

Reviews.Title: mid price, low quality
Reviews.Author: Aric
Reviews.Content: I have Nikon D40 DSLR. I figured I should have something compact for trips and such.It produces the lowest quality pictures I ever saw, especialy in low lighting.Stay away from this camera !!!

Reviews.Title: Very unsatisfied--From a digital camera owner of many models
Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: As a digital camera owner of many different models, owned several models from Canon(A series, S series and dSLR), nikon and fuji, too, this Canon A2200 is very disappointing. It's very hard to focus in low light conditions and even harder when making a video in low light. And the sound is very bad when making a video, very muffy and not consistent. I used my very old Canon SD1000 and this new Canon A2200 to take videos at exactly the same time and the SD1000 gave perfect focus(no pre-focus needed) and sound effect(clear and crispy, nearby or far away sounds). But the Canon A2200 gave very unclear sounds and it took forever to focus when taking a pic or video.Stay away from this A2200. Very disappointed with Canon this time.

Reviews.Title: A Gift
Reviews.Author: Eviebarbi
Reviews.Content: This is a gift so I don't know how well the camera works but I noticed that the body is cheap. Seems like made of thin metal case like a toy. No SD Card either. Perhaps new cams don't get them. But I like the color, it's Dark Purple/Blue.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rocks
Reviews.Author: ecreed
Reviews.Content: Its a great little camera. Takes sharp pictures.  I wish I had waited to purchase it, however.  I could have gotten it $40 cheaper locally at Target.  I wish Amazon had a price garantee.

Reviews.Title: Worst Canon Ever
Reviews.Author: Izabella Medvinsky
Reviews.Content: I have had many Canon cameras throughout the years (my unfortunate tendency to take them everywhere means they get banged up a lot).  And I've always been satisfied until this one.  It is HORRIBLE.  If there is any sunlight at all, the pictures come out completely white.  It does not register the color green for the most part.  Worst of all, the videos taken are in some primitive format that I've no idea how to work with - what on earth was wrong with AVI?  I am going ot be buying a new camera come Black Friday, because I just can't stand this one.

Reviews.Title: Not a point-and-click
Reviews.Author: contractswriter
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had to return this camera. It's not a simple point-and-click and the "auto focus" isn't quite what it's touted to be. You have to hold the shutter button down half way until it finds it's focus and then take the picture. We read the manual, tried different settings, and it's just not an easy camera for action shots (most of our pictures are action). It was a great little camera/video otherwise, but not what we needed for easy and quick photos. 3/4 of the photos I took at a wedding were blurry, didn't matter if they were inside or out.

Reviews.Title: i don't remember dates..
Reviews.Author: bugbama
Reviews.Content: Does anybody please tell me if you can put the DATES in the picture of this camera. I have canon sd600, but won't print dates on the picture. It is important to me to see the dates of its photos that I have taken so I could keep track of my two girls progress. Thanks i am disperate to know.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!
Reviews.Author: JenJan
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought this camera for my mom on Mother's day and it was a total waste of money! The first time she used, she loved it and the pictures came out great! We went to a concert last week and brought the camera (second time using it) and right when we turn it on THE LENS JAMMED and now it won't work. We keep receiving a message that states lens error and restart camera. Mind you, we have NEVER dropped the camera and there was no dirt or anything on the camera. It was in perfect condition! I decided to do some research to see if I could fix it myself and it turns out that a lot of their Powershot cameras have this issue and people want to charge $100 just to fix it! Might as well buy a new camera. But I'm definitely not going to buy a Canon!

Reviews.Title: This is now my favorite camera
Reviews.Author: sveeds
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many different functions it makes taking pictures a breeze.  I was able to take a clear picture of the moon which was really cool.  Also with the software that came with my canon printer I am able to take pictures from a video.  Very good purchase.

Reviews.Content: Everything in its place and the item is exactly it is introduced. The camera is not good. I do not like the quality of the pictures. It takes pictures with 7 Mp, it seems.

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: Michelle Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before, but I had to share my disappointment with this camera!  I have owned Canon Powershot cameras for over 8 years but the quality of this was is so poor that I'm returning it to Amazon!
